article.class: post-2119 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-featured

header.h1: WPS COVID-19 Continuity of Learning Plan

p.br:
-Make decisions based upon information shared by the Superintendent of Schools
-Serve as a liaison between the school and community

-Provide leadership/guidance to the administration and staff.
-Create environments that allow flexibility for staff in order for them to serve the needs of their students during this time.
-Ensure that equity is upheld for students of poverty/limited technology access
-Stay informed: Be involved in virtual meetings as needed (Public Health Departments, Winnebago Tribe of Nebraska, Commissioner of Education, ESU #1 Superintendents, etc.).
-Stay up-to-date on ever changing laws/statutes regarding Education and COVID-19
-Create and distribute the WPS COVID-19 Continuity of Learning Plan
-Monitor Administrators’ Time and Effort Loges to ensure expectations are being met

-Support faculty and students/families while shifting to an alternate learning environment
-Help teachers implement WPS COVID-19 Continuity of Learning Plan
-Monitor communication between teachers and their students
Keep staff informed and provide guidance regarding on-going expectations through virtual meetings
-Monitor Teachers’ Time and Effort Logs to ensure expectations are being met
-Organize/Plan/Schedule for the 2020-2021 School Year
Maintain Daily Time and Effort Logs
-Be available via email, zoom, phone, and text to parents/students/ teachers/staff between the hours of 8-3, at a minimum, per the school calendar
-Be available for emergency/crisis situations beyond regular school hours

-Provide support to faculty and students/families that may not have technology support when it is required.
-Support faculty and students/families shifting to an alternate learning environment
-Provide written/virtual support to assist faculty with using district identified resources as needed

-Collaborate and meet via virtual platforms with administration.
-Make sure parents are aware which online resources your students will access. Include information on how to access the resources.
-Create packets of Review/Reinforcement/Enrichment activities with state standards identified; these activities will not be graded.
-Be available during school hours (8-3) to administration, parents, and students.
-Communicate with and provide timely feedback to administration, students and parents.
-Teachers will participate in assigned and volunteer professional development opportunities (google classroom, Discovery Education, virtual field trips, zoom, online platforms, etc.).
-Teachers will prepare district pacing guides and align state standards for the 2020-2021 school year.
-Staff will maintain a daily Time and Effort log.
-Staff will maintain a student/parent contact log.

-Collaborate and meet via zoom with administration.
-Make sure parents are aware which online resources your students will access. Include information on how to access the resources.
-Creating packets with enrichment activities identifying state standards. Enrichment activities will not be returned.
-Make yourself available during school hours (8-3) to administration, parents, and students.
-Communicate with and provide timely feedback to both students and parents.
-Teachers will participate in assigned/ volunteer professional development opportunities (google classroom, discovery education, virtual field trips, zoom, online platforms, etc).
-Teachers will prepare district pacing guides and align state standards for the 2020-2021 school year.
-Staff will maintain a daily log and effort log.
-Staff will maintain a student/parent contact log.
-Communicate regularly with the regular ed. teachers who teach the students on your caseload.
-Communicate regularly with students on your caseload and their parents.
-Provide supplementary learning activities for students on your caseload that you already provide direct instruction for.
-Make sure all special education guidelines and regulations are followed.

-Make contact with all clients.
-Set up continuation of services schedule for all clients.

p.strong: Classified Staff Supervisors (Grounds Transportation, Maintenance, and Food Service)
p.br:
-Ensure building area/ grounds are maintained
-Ensure support staff know schedules and job assignments
-Ensure materials/ food are ordered to ensure the continued feeding of our students.

p.strong: Support Staff (food service personnel, paraprofessionals, and custodial staff)
p.br:
-Ensure enrichment packets are put together
-Deliver enrichment packets if not picked up
-Prepare breakfast and lunch for all students ages 1-18.
-Help with pickup and delivery of breakfast and lunch.
-Maintain the building while students are away(clean/disinfect following COVID-19 guidelines).

p.strong: Office Staff (finance, receptionist/ other office personnel, human resources)
p.br:
-Maintain finances in orderly fashion
-Payrolls are done on time
-Accounts payable are taken care of in a timely manner
-Ensure purchase orders are properly handled
-Ensure federal, state and grant reports are completed as required
-Receptionist/ other office personnel
-Receive phone calls
-Make copies
-Help other staff when available
-Human Resources
-Ensure all personnel files are kept current

-Provide support for your children by doing as many of these things as possible:
-Establishing routines and expectations with your kids (times for studying, quiet time, etc.)
-SPED/504: Make sure you maintain contact with both classroom teachers and special ed. teachers
-Defining the physical space for your child to study
-Monitor communications from your child’s teachers/communicate with child’s teachers as needed
-Taking an active role in helping your child process his/her learning
-Encouraging physical activity and/or exercise
-Be mindful of your child’s stress or worry – Don’t add stress to yourself!
-WPS Staff are here for you!
-Support your child’s social connections, but set rules around social media interactions

-Ensure your success by doing the following:
-Grades K-6: Enrichment activities are available weekly. They will not be graded.
-Grades 7-12: Enrichment activities are available weekly (pick up or delivery).
-Check your emails daily for emails from teachers.
-Teachers will have weekly scheduled virtual office hours via zoom.
-Late work must be completed and turned in via email.
-Enrichment activities will indicate the state standards being met.
-Enrichment activities for all students K-12 are not to be returned. They are for the students’ benefit.

br.br:
-Contact Teacher in the content area or homeroom teacher. All staff email addresses are posted on the WPS website.
https://winnebagopublicschools.org/

br.em: A personal, academic or social-emotional concern

p.br:
Dan Fehringer, Superintendent
dfehringer@winnebagok12.org
Cheryl Burrell, Assistant Superintendent
cburrell@winnebagok12.org
Lori Tremayne, Principal (JH, HS)
ltremayne@winnebagok12.org
Adam James, Principal (Elem.)
ajames@winnebagok12.org
Joe Gubbels, Special Education Director
jgubbels@winnebagok12.org
